intro: Rhacoma pungens, commonly known as the spiny rhacoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, spiny leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Rhacoma pungens is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
